Reviews.Title: “Great location and good conditions”
Reviews.Author: Winter1966
Reviews.Content: I've stayed there between 13 and 18th of April 2012. The hotel location is great, close to the beach.One minor issue is that across the street( at a safe distance) was some municipal utility and also a car park for towed cars. But there was no disturbance from thhose facilities. The access to the city is simple, one bus passing in front of the hotel and two underground stations at 10-12 minutes walking. The breakfast was good. A rather minor issue is that there are small ( I MEAN) small details related to cleanliness, but nothing really serious and annoying for normal people. Would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for beach and easy access to the city via 41 bus”
Reviews.Author: suzegr
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a superb location. We had a lovely view of the sea although I would recommend asking for a floor above the first floor as your view won't be tainted by the car park/sportsground across the road. The 41 and tourist bus stops are less than a two minute walk away. The 41 bus comes every 5-10minutes and bring you right into the city centre. For a different evening when it's raining outside there is access to a small gym/sauna and steam room. While small it was just a fantastic bonus. There is also a jacuzzi although this was out of service during our stay. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The buffet breakfast was a great start to the day. The only downside about the hotel was the sound. The walls appear to be paper thin and everything can be heard but thankfully we weren't disturbed too much!

Reviews.Title: “Best of both worlds”
Reviews.Author: luxsey
Reviews.Content: Used our Tesco rewards to stay here so basically was free. Cashed in £105 which gave us 3 nights B&B and we also had a lovely sea view and a nice bottle of Cava (only available on stays till 30/4/12). We were on a budget break. Flew with Ryanair to BCN and got train from T2 (look for long covered walkway) Buy a T10 ticket for 10 journeys on all the public transport-airport train included, metro, buses and trams good value at €9.25- can be passed back to others in your party to use. Cheapest airport transfer we have ever used! Machines at the airport train station. Trains leave at 08 and 38. We got off at Paseig de Gracia and then transferred to the L4 metro yellow line direct La Pau. We then tried to avoid changing at Passieg de Gracia as it is a lot of going up and down stairs and a very long walkway! We got off at Selva de Mar (exit Selva de Mar not Prozenca) and followed the road Selva de Mar to the sea then turned right. Hotel was 2 blocks along. took about 10mins. Room was fine for the 3 of us (2adults &1 child). No tea or coffee facilities in room but you can get a coffee in the bar for less than €2. Beer was also reasonable for a hotel. Beds were very comfy and bathroom was a good size. Breakfasts were fine- the cheese with the black rind was gorgeous! We ate in the hotel one night. Opens at 8.30pm. €15 set meal was good value. 3 courses with glass of wine, bread and olives. We had steak which was nice enough. Didn't use gym didn't realise there was a jacuzzi as would have brought our cozzies. Diagonal Mar Shopping centre was 10 min walk away and there was a big supermarket to stock up on water and snacks. It was nice having the beach across the road and if it was warmer we would have used it. We did walk from la Ramblas and it took about an hour but lovely promenade. On the whole would return if got a good room rate and would recommend to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the beach”
Reviews.Author: Les B
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a 20 minute bus ride from the centre of Barcelona in the Olympic area close to one of the beaches. Restaurants and supermarkets are thin on the ground in the area. We took a family trip partly over Easter, if you want to shop forget it as they are all closed for the duration, and arrived late afternoon,. As we had a baby with us I had requested three adjoining rooms and a cot which the hotel had confirmed. On checkin there was no notification of the cot and only two rooms were adjoining, not a good start! When we got to the 9th floor we found the rooms were adjoining only by number not physically! THe beds were king size and comfortable but the maid only straigtened the top to make it look good. Being Easter the breakfast was chaotic and it was only on our last day we found the hot food tucked away behind a pillar. If you stay here invest in a Barcelona card as you will be using the transport system a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the beach and catching the Tourist bus!!”
Reviews.Author: Susiepoosy1003
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from this hotel and have to say we thought it was fine. The rooms are a fair size with a hairdryer, tv and mini bar etc. The breakfast is basic but ok. The service is brilliant. We needed help with the safe and someone was up to our room in 2 minutes...and we asked for a iron and one and a board was sent up straight away. Anything you need, just ask at reception and they will find out for you. We were delayed at the airport due to an Air traffic control in France and when we called the hotel they put us in the last available room without any fuss as all. The only downside to the room was that in the morning you got woken by other doors shutting and making the room shake!! We never took the metro but a station was very close by. We did go on the "Bus Touristic" and recommend this in order to see as much of Barcelona as you can. It stops at all the major attractions and you can jump on and off as much as you like for no extra cost. The closest stop is a 2 minute walk so is easy from this hotel. We strolled along the promenade all the way to La Rambla and it took over an hour, but it is a lovely flat walk. The beach looks lovely for a city...we didn't go on as we had too much sightseeing to do...it is VERY busy on a Sunday.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bailyhowth
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 7th floor of this hotel.. had view of beach. It was super to wake up to every morning. Very nice hotel, friendly staff, short walk to metro. Cool bar. Will come back here next time I visit this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Smart, Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveller7481
Reviews.Content: This hotel is smart and exceptionally clean. It is situated on a main road but also overlooks the sea. The staff on the whole were pleasant and helpful. We stayed in March for a week and although the weather was warm the Air Conditioning wasn’t on in the hotel. We were told it doesn’t get switched on until around Easter time regardless off the temperature outside. Therefore our room was very warm indeed. A rather unsatisfactory answer in my opinion! The hotel food was fairly standard. The breakfast buffet consisted of cold meats, cheese, fruit and croissants/pastries. The hot buffet however left a lot to be desired – consisting of the same 3 items each day – scrambled egg drenched in oil, mini sausages and broccoli (!). The hotel offers lunch and dinner but with a limited menu. The restaurant doesn’t open in the evening until 8.30pm which we found inconvenient - it was usually empty. The bar/lounge has a much better menu which was available most of the day. There is a large shopping complex nearby (about 10min walk away) called Diagonal Mar. This has fast food outlets (open all day) but also several other restaurants, some with outside seating areas but these don’t open until approx 8pm. There are a couple of restaurants almost next door to the hotel also with a late evening opening time. There is a bus service outside the hotel which goes to the top of Las Ramblas taking approx 25mins (to walk takes just over an hour). The hotel has a car park which charges 15 Euros a day however driving in Barcelona is a rather stressful experience!

Reviews.Title: “friendly and honest”
Reviews.Author: nick3317
Reviews.Content: arrived in Barcelona and my originally booked room in another hotel was not available. did few hotels all were quoting abusive prices been on the day and also in middle of a food show. the Barcelo quoted me honest price and so helpful.this is good customer practice i would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel, far away from city centre but close to beach”
Reviews.Author: Douglas M
Reviews.Content: Let's get the elephant in the room out straight away - if you are looking for a hotel that is close to the city centre, sights, restaurants, etc. - this ain't it. You are at least a 7 to 10 Euro taxi ride to anything that you would want to see or do - except the beach. It is very close to it and it has a beautiful boardwalk that runs along the coast. In fact, I really enjoyed walking the boardwalk to the Pullman hotel that my colleagues were staying in (30 minute walk up the beach). Be aware, it is close to the beach but not the high traffic/restaurant area of the beach. A bus did stop in front of the hotel but I didn't use it. When I arrived at the hotel the reception staff were nice, bilingual, and helpful. However, there were no offers to take my bags (coming or going) and/or luggage cart that I saw. The hotel room was medium size for European standards but most North American visitors will think it small. The bed was comfortable, pillows were thin and firm. I was on the 10th floor and heard no traffic below or much of any sounds in the hotel. The room was clean and neat. The shower had excellent pressure and it came with a bathrobe and 2 bath towels. The room came with wireless internet and found it to be of a reasonable quality. The downside is that you can only authenticate one device at a time, not good for those with laptops, tablets, and phones. Room service was pretty quick (20 min.). The food was okay at a reasonable price - for hotel room service. The two times I had it the staff answering the phone were not fully bilingual which limited special orders, however, I was in Spain so I didn't have expectations of everyone being bilingual in the hotel. They were polite and seemed to have tried their best. The breakfast buffet was good. Decent selection of pastries, bread, meats, etc. It somewhat changed from day to day allowing you to eat there almost everyday without getting overly bored of it. I was debating about giving the hotel four stars but I just couldn't get past that it wasn't particularly special. Nothing great, nor poor happened while I was there so an average score is what I felt was appropriate.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: MelandJudy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well placed on the outskirts of Barcelona with only a short walk/taxi to The Ramblas etc. Food is pretty standard with continental the main breakfast with cereal/egg also available. The rooms are large and have great facilities and the miniibar prices aren't over the top. If your room is at the front overlooking the beach (well if you stand on a chair) then it is quite noisy but you do get used to it. Ordered room service and a large bottle of water, burger and fruit salad was under 20 euros. The bar is also well stocked and is comfortable to meet up. Didn't eat in the restaurant in the evening as it didn't open until 8:30pm which is late for us Brits! Overall a really great hotel that doesn't rip you off

Reviews.Title: “Wifi not working for me. Not happy at all. Not recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: paeman
Reviews.Content: No solution offered for wifi not working for me. Argument: it works for all others... or only works with internet explorer etc. I have travelled for 2weeks in europe and it worked in all other hotels, so draw your own conclusion. So really not happy. If you want and need wifi better not take the risk and choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: charbiebarbie
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend visitied this hotel in May 2011 for a 2 night break with Tesco Clubcard Rewards Vouchers. I had read many reviews on here about getting to the hotel from the airport, so decided to take the bus rather than the easy taxi journey. It was a little bit confusing and hectic to figure out but as soon as you did it was a doddle. This hotel is quite out of the hustle and bustle of main Barcelona city and you do have to get on a bus to get to Las Ramblas but i prefered this. The hotel is situated on the sea front (however you do have to cross a very busy main road to get to the beach), but the beach is definitely worth a visit - it was warm enough in May for us to both lie for a few hours of chilled sunbathing (watch out for the nudists tho - we were a little surprised to see men sunbathing naked there as we hadnt read any reviews stating this). Our room was small but comfortable and modernly decorated - unfortunately we didnt have a sea view but had a view of a park are behind the hotel which was ok. The main lobby area was very modern too and breakfast in the restaurant was lovely. If you come out of the main door of the hotel you would walk to your right to catch the bus into the main centre. If you turn left out of the doors you can walk a few minutes, take another left to Diagonal Mar shopping centre - this has restaurants and shops galore and is great...wish we'd had found it on the first night. We did the Nou Camp Open top bus tour route whilst there - definitely worth doing as you get to see some great historic sites including the cathedral, but remember suncream for your shoulders if your on the top deck in the summer months! Now i know how to get around Barcelona i would definitely go again and would consider staying at this hotel again, as i do like to walk whilst on holiday - however if you prefer to have the nightlife and main stretch at your feet i would stay nearer to the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: CarineSlot
Reviews.Content: Friendly people, big and comfortable rooms, seasight close to the beach and the promenade and close to public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay in Hotel Near the Beach”
Reviews.Author: MrStraightTalker
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to Barcelona beach, only separated by a main road. Arriving by public transport, you have two options: - Take L4 Metro and get off at Poble Nou. From here it's a fairly straight 10-15 minute walk to the hotel. - Take the No 41 bus, which zig-zags towards the beach on a 20-25 minute trip from Urquinaona. Although this may seem difficult, the trips are ok! It appeared as if you could park underground if driving. The hotel was very smart and clean, with good sized rooms. Staff on reception were friendly and supplied a map of the local area. They also helped book a trip. Free WiFi was available in the room, which was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Decent rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: RAJU007
Reviews.Content: I took the metro from the airport and the hotel was a bit further away from the nearest stop but eventually made it. Clean rooms, a bit small in size. Had food from the resaturent but would not recommend it. Infact there is a small shopping mall in walking distance which has a few good restaurents. But overall nice!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Quite Place just opposite to beach”
Reviews.Author: anujseth4
Reviews.Content: We have stayed this hotel from 21st to 27th Sept, 2011 with a group tour organized by Orbitz, India for visit to ITMA Exhibition. The location of hotel is little far from city but just opposite to beach. Also, it is near to Port Olimpic where good casinos and restaurants are famous for night life. The rooms are neat & tidy with good air conditioning. They also provide iron with board during morning hours. Bathrooms are spic & span, only problem they couldn't fixed was jammed drain cover of bidet which we have to remove everyday before use. Our tour operator has organized Indian dinners so not to much say about food. In the breakfast the most appealing dish was fresh Cheese, pure white, smooth & soft. its taste was too yummy. On whole the breakfast was sumptuous and delicious. Over all its a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: markdunlaoire
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a I was going to say a six night stay at this hotel but when we arrived the first night they had made an error and were fully booked. The gentleman on reception apologised profusely and arranged for us to stay in an ajacent hotel for the night and we got the next five nights in an upgraded room at no extra charge so not complaining. We walked all over Barcelona and it was a nice walk along the sea front into the city. The hotel is spotless and seems to be geared for business people and the staff are a bit stand offish but I would definietly go back Best piece of advice is get a taxi from the airport to the hotel we paid over seventy pounds for a speedy shuttle bus that was a disaster from start to finish.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Views”
Reviews.Author: travelfanaticsUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Atenea Mar for 3 nights courtesy of Tesco, using our club card vouchers. We got there from the airport by RENFE train to Passeig de Gracia then the metro (L4 -yellow line) using T10 tickets (E8.25 for a 10-use ticket) which we bought at the RENFE station in the airport. We got off at Poblenou, but Selva de Mar is actually a bit nearer the hotel. Although we had booked a 'superior' (standard) room, we got upgraded to a sea-view room, which was excellent. The view was great and we saw the sunrise every morning. The room was in very good decorative condition, had a modern TV and a lovely bathroom, with lots of nice shower gels, shampoos etc, It had a bath and a shower over the bath. There was plenty of storage space and a safe. There was also a mini bar which we used to keep our bottled water cool. The only thing missing was a kettle and tea/coffee things. They even have free wifi . You have to ask about it at reception. The service was excellent too. I broke a glass and we put the wrong code in the safe and locked it with our things in it. When I told reception about both things they dealt with them very quickly - in about 2 minutes someone came to vacuum any remaining glass off the floor and within about 7 minutes someone came to sort the safe out. The reception staff were very helpful too - they rang a restaurant for us as our spanish is not so good. Breakfast was good, apart from the hot stuff (undercooked bacon & frankfurters) although the scrambled eggs were good. There was cold meat, cheese, hard boiled eggs, bread (and a toaster), lovely fresh pastries, cereal, yogurt (plain only), various juices, tea, coffee, hot chocolate - all self service. The restaurant had a E15 menu with 3 courses and a drink. We didn't try it as my husband didn't fancy anything on the menu (its a matter of personal taste!). We ate at the Chinese restaurant next door (Orilla de Mar) which was pretty standard chinese fare. We used the hop on/hop off bus to get into town. The green route stops just outside the hotel - don't believe the Turisme website which says the green route stops in September - it runs all the year round. You can get a pack from the hotel which has a discount voucher for the bus and a map of barcelona and get your ticket (for 1 or 2 days) the first time you use the bus. We also used the bus in the evenings to get to the Olympic Port. We ate there one night and in Barceloneta the other, getting a taxi back (buses stop at 21:00). The taxi was E5 one night and E9 the other. I'd definitely use the hotel again and would recommend it.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Leif E
Reviews.Content: Great Location. Nice view. Friendly staff. The downs are the internet service, you will need a password & a movil phone to be able to get access. (Please ask the front desk). Also is 25 minutes from the airport. (Taxi will charge you around 20 to 30 euros). I will recomend this hotel just because the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: BambangKaro
Reviews.Content: I selected another Barcelo Group hotel after having nice experience in one of the group's hotel in Madrid. And it's the best choice I've made. The hotel service was perfect, interior was futuristic and excellent, a lot of tourists were checking with me at the same time, and when we walked outside, it's near to the hop on hop off bus stop. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “best for business not pleasure”
Reviews.Author: jboats
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Barcelo Atenia Mar recently and it had all the requirements for a nice hotel, clean rooms, good size room, very modern, great view of the sea. The a.c. could have been better, there is little control for it. Also, when you leave your room all power turns off when you pull your room card out of the power box, so the room gets warm again. The bus 41 takes you into the city, but navigating the system takes work. Best to go to the red " i " small i for "information" in the Catalunya plaza, near the fountain area going down the steps, they can help with how to buy transportation tickets for 1 day or longer, plus other excursions. Also some things only take cash the Sagrada Familia -Gaudi only takes cash...we didn't bring enough, our atm didn't work, and they don't do cash advances from your credit card in Spain. So we could only do things with the credit card and had to hold on to the cash for departing needs. LOVED Barcelona...lots of restaurants not all great...but many to choose from. Love the old mixing with the new design and architecture a feast for the eyes... the beach was great very close to the hotel, but wanted to experience the city more, wish we stayed closer in the city. The cafes down on the right from the hotel are "ok" the last one not that great.. Hotel restaurant was good...of course pricey all hotel restaurants are a bit more, but being tired after a long day, it was worth it. Lastly...the hotel staff work very hard...not sure what the "managers" do...they won't speak to you or help and behaved very grumpy as though they were too important to speak to you......being in the hospitality business for 15 years myself...I've never seen managers who were so much in view...but not very pleasant or helpful. Not one person during the entire 6 days stay asked how we were or how our visit was going and if they could help with anything. I found that strange...I'm not sure if maybe the Spanish culture doesn't have hospitality phrases, that staff should say to their guests. We managed fine on our own but kind assistance wasn't offered.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel but more for business than pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Skintbloke
Reviews.Content: Thsi is a modern and clean hotel situated at the beach in Barcelona. All the hotel services were very good and the staff were friendly and helpful. We were staying for pleasure and the hotel location is not best for access to the central areas. The Metro is about a 15 minute walk and in the heat it can seem a bit longer. Overall if you dont mind a bit of a walk to and from the hotel a couple of times a day then you receive good value for money. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: momo317
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 12 noon,tired and exhausted. We had walked from the Metro in 31 degree heat. All we wanted to do was leave our bags because we were too early for check in. The receptionist looked at the room list and said our room was ready and we could go straight up. So grateful. The room was very luxurious and very clean. Looked out of the window right onto the Med - fantastic view. Straight into the shower which was superb. Lovely large spotless towels. Only small quibble is that TV could have more English channels. Breakfast was very enjoyable with a large selection of hot and cold items. Used either the 41 bus or the metro, both very handy Would return tomorrow

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Daniak4
Reviews.Content: We had a comfortable stay, the rooms were clean, modern and a good size for two adults and a child. This is a business hotel, they're not geared up for kids to be running around, nor do they have a play area, if it's what your family need then think again, this was not a problem for us with a 12 year old but it maybe if you have little one's. The staff were as helpful as we needed them to be, no problems there. Due to other reviews we opted to eat breakfast at the local restuarants a 3min walk away, they have a good variety of food including a fry up if you just can't live without one, much better value for money. For travel to the centre of Barcelona this is a good location, the 41 bus stops on the corner of the hotel and takes 15mins to Catalunya. The train station is a 10min walk and so is the shopping centre which has all you could need including food shops and restaurants, there are supermarkets behind the hotel which I recommend you buy your drinks from to store in the mini bar, unless you don't mind spending the extra on hotel prices. The beach, is a walk across the road and a fabulous bonus either before or after visiting all the amazing sights Barcelona has to offer. Be warned it is a topless beach but the Spanish are very blaze and this makes it a comfortable atmosphere,not sleazy. What a beautiful city this is. Everything you could ever want to buy is here, if you like to shop, you will not be disappointed, the architecture is incredible and the variety of food is plentiful. Take your walking shoes, each corner we turned had a new adventure, we seemed to stumble across so many surprises on our way around the city. The Gaudi is of course a must. Buy yourself a T10 card and every bus/ train journey will only cost 80 cents as apposed to 1.40 euro a trip. The Picasso museum is free on the first Sunday of every month after 3pm, the queues are endless but we went back around 5.30pm and had a 5min wait. We decided not to spend 40 euros each way on taxis to and from the airport and opted for the very easy service of the Aerobus, 5 euros each into Catalunya then the 41 to the hotel. We didn't try the food at the hotel, there were so many other places near by and we were out all day till late so we ate at the lovley places we came across, this was a nicer cultural experience rather than the same crowd of guests every day at the tables. Variety is the spice of life. Enjoy your stay here if you are inspired to do so, we did, and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel , very courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: london61
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very clean , very courteous and helpful staff.We took the double family room . visited with my wife and two kids under 7 years old . Hotel is near beach and a few minutes walk from station . Sleva de Mar . Downside , no tea or coffee making facilities and breakfast is 10 euros per person , better to turn left or right when you come out of hotel ,there are lots of cafes doing english breakfast for under 5 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and nice beachfront location but a trek to city sights.”
Reviews.Author: bfc2406
Reviews.Content: This hotel was chosen purely or convenience to the beach, for a relaxing post cruise short stay. It fit the bill well. When we wanted to explore a little further the staff were super, very helpful. metro and buses were nearby if needed. The beach was a short stroll away, with children's play areas and eateries. A simple but nice breakfast was provided too. As we had a late flight out of Barcelona, the hotel only charged us ten euro to keep the room until four, which was a great help. A good hotel, but not one to stay at if you are going to see the sights if Barcelona will it's distance away.

Reviews.Title: “Loves it!”
Reviews.Author: Perrault29
Reviews.Content: Stayed there last week for the for time. Got and updrade toma suite for an extra 30 euros per night and the room was great! Love the location by the beach and the easy access. Also near subway station and Diagonal Mar shopping center. If you need a cab back from where the action is it's only about a 10 euros ride. For the price we find this one fantastic value. I would say the main bug for us was the elevators which are too small and too slow...and our room was on the top floor...

Reviews.Title: “NO CUSTOMER SERVICE HERE!! don´t book unless you like smarm and glares and unhelpfulness”
Reviews.Author: LovelyLaura2206
Reviews.Content: Booked here for 3 days prior to a cruise and no problems ... however, as we have a late night flight back to UK tonight we booked a room prior to departing on the 13th August. reception staff advised us to do the boking online as it is cheaper - and of course means that the hotel itself doesn´t have to refud any money to us themselves! We were told that the hotel was not fully booked for the 20th, and that although we would probably have to wait for a room, we should have no problem in getting in by 10am. I am typing this at 11.35 am. we have no room. The reception staff smirked their way through a schpiel which basically said that rooms were not available until 4pm on the day of check in. We had made it clear at the time of booking that we just needed the room for a few hours so that we could freshen ourelves up before fights home, so why on earth would we pay for one rom for a day (and a night that we will not use but they were too greedy to agree to just a day rate - most good hotels are very hapy to do a day rate for guests, but I guess they must need the money, otherwise they would surely employ more friendly staff. I guess having just disembarked from the Disney ship, we have had a week where nothing was too much trouble and the staff were, without exeception, friendly, cheerful and endlessly helpful - i think the staff here should be sent on one of their customer services courses - it would serve them well. It´s amazed us that the spanish guy who could not speak english a week ago when trying to help us with our hotel safe has suddenly developed a fluency that has astounded us this morning when advising us that there would not be a room ready until 4pm. His side kick - a ver smarmy woman who looked so pinched that she probably doubles up as a clearner by poking a brush up her bottom was even more annoying and just stared into space as if in a trance, must occasionally adding some smirky rude remark to her compatriate! So, avoid this place! ..... just got a room by making a sit in in the reception area! rfesult!!

Reviews.Title: “Great seaview location out of city centre”
Reviews.Author: sweetbrunette
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend just before Easter. This is the sea-view, out-of-city-centre Barcelo (there are others in the city centre), with nice gym and amazing views, and you can get it on tescovouchers. We had a top-floor room looking over the sea, with beautiful views! The gym is petite and compact and nicely cool and empty. The room safe was too small for the laptop so we left it with front desk staff - always advisable practice - and there is a bus stop just outside, very convenient, as the metro stations are a bit of a walk away. Underground connections are very good but merge with the overground train lines in places which can get very confusing. The airport is the far side of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Location”
Reviews.Author: athea1b
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fairly affordable and in a great location, right opposite the beach, so we had a very pleasant view each morning to wake up to. If you visit this hotel in Barcelona anytime during the summer season especially in July/august, you can surely expect the sun to be out and in full blaze! The hotel itself was within walking distance to the bus 41 which takes you straight into town, and not too far from a supermarket and a shopping centre. Only complaints I had is that the hotel staff could do a better job when cleaning the rooms, the maids always wanted to hurry you out and sometimes the rooms were not adequately cleaned! Which was a disappointment. Other than that good breakfast, and other services were provided. So very good!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: Nina1991
Reviews.Content: It took me a long time to resurchI spend a lot time researching before I made our reservation for this hotel and still I didn't know what to expect. The hotel was great, very modern and clean. My family loved the rooms and the location. The hotel is across the beach and if you are looking for some time to spend by the sea and be close to the center of Barcelona you have the right hotel-perfect spot. The bus stop is outside the hotel very convenient. We didn't eat at the restaurant so I can't comment on the food, but the bar service was great. Internet is free. The hotel staff was outstanding. My son got some stomach virus and he developed a fever in the middle of the night and my husband who doesn't speak any Spanish had to find an open pharmacy, so the hotel staff came to the rescue-called him a taxi, directed the taxi driver to the location and asked him to wait. The next night at 3am we had take our son at the hospital, again the hotel administrator helped us to get there. The last thing was that we had to check out the next day but because the hospital was close to this hotel I asked if we could stay one additional night knowing that this may not be possible or the rate will be a lot higher of what I have paid, but they let us keep the room and charge me the same rate. If we go back to Barcelona we would love to stay at the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, amazing service!!”
Reviews.Author: Gilda01
Reviews.Content: Great location, a little far from downtown, but if you like to walk is not so bad (About 25 min). The hotel is clean, the service outstanding, the restaurant and bar at the lobby are great, good food. I usually went to la Barceloneta for dinner, Bestial was one of my favorites, then the bars are fun to. The terrazas at the new hotels W and Omm are great, nice view, great drinks. There is also a great tapas bar by the Cathedral Euskal next to Bubo, great place for drinks and dessert!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the beach but a bit far from town”
Reviews.Author: redheadsturnheads
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed here for the Barcelona Half-Marathon. The hotel was very nice and had great views of the coast. Our room was spacious and modern. The breakfast was a typical continental affair and the drinks at the bar were served in gold fish bowls. The hotel was a little quiet and it is a little far away from the nighlife

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: PeteVaasa_Finland
Reviews.Content: I was first time in Barcelona and spent five nights. The best thing was great sea views and location next to a nice beach. Walking to and from the subway station twice a day was a bit irritating but I never tried taxi or bus. There were several supermarkets on the way from the subway. The room was very clean and the bed sheets were changed every other day. It was quite hot in late June but the A/C was extremely effective. The bathroom was also spacious and clean. TV was old and only had a few international channels, which didn’t suit to the modern style of the hotel. Cheking in and out was easy. The safety box in my room didn’t work when I arrived, but someone from staff came and fixed the problem within ten minutes I called the reception. Breakfast was included in my room rate and it was ok but not great as I’m used to Scandinavian style breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hl2826
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights and were very impressed with all aspects of the hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful and most of the staff spoke English. The food was great, especially the tapas lunch menu, although we didn't try the breakfast. We also found that the price of food and drink at the hotel was very reasonable considering it is a four star city hotel. The hotel was very clean, we continually saw the cleaners in the corridors and in the bar/foyer. The rooms were large and comfortable, although unfortunately we didn't get a sea view! We were apprehensive about the location after reading some reviews but we found that the hotel was perfectly positioned on the beachfront, not too close to the city centre. The metro (which was very easy to use- and went to all the tourist spots we wanted!) was a very short walk away, and taxis to the centre were about 8 euros one way. There was a large shopping centre about 10 minutes walk away and a small supermarket just behind the hotel. We will definitely be staying here again when we revisit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Across the Road from the beach. Nice Rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Wengen_trip
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two days using Visa points. The location is perfect. Just across the road from the beach where you can walk miles in either direction along very pristine, clean beaches. The room was large and well appointed. The staff was reasonably helpful but there were significant differences in the English abilities -- from fluent to barely passable. The hotel restaurant was average, the bar was quite nice. The decor is modern and comfortable. For the location, the price is reasonable. It's not real close to the subway, and about a 20 min walk to the Las Ramblas/City Center. Cab rides are easy to find and not bad - about $8 Euro to get to all the main attractions and about $20 to the airport. One complaint, the A/C was just passable. No matter where you set it, the hotel clearly modifies and raises the temp I assume in an energy savings measure so if you're trying to sleep in be aware. Overall. a solid hotel and if you're looking for beach time a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful sea views, but a little way from the centre”
Reviews.Author: linden-s
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel - we upgraded our room to sea view for another 20euro per night, which was very good value. It's located some distance from the centre, however the 41 bus stops almost outside and the green tourist bus stops a little further along to the right from the hotel. The tourist bus is well worth paying for as the green/red/blue routes will take you all over Barcelona and for the 2-day pass it was good value. Our room was well fitted out although no kettle to make drinks, but there was a minibar and the bathroom was very large, clean and well appointed. Efficient aircon was nice to have, and it was quiet in operation. Breakfast was quite reasonable, but not wonderful in terms of choice. The scrambled eggs were probably the best I've ever eaten though, highly recommend them to anyone. Although we were on the 11th floor, traffic noise could still be heard to some extent, and Barcelona is clearly a 24-hour city, so ask for a high floor if noise is likely to bother you. Staff were extremely helpful on the reception desk and spoke excellent English.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant value for money”
Reviews.Author: Mikey888888
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from staying at barcelo atheana with my girlfriend. As a young couple we found it brilliant value for money was amazing really clean and spacious room. It is far from the city bus 41 took you straight there. We took a cab back every night which was only 10 euros I would recommend staying here as the centre is to busy and if you want to get away from that you can relax on the beach just opposit the hotel. The only downfall of the hotel there is no information at all about Barcelona what to do or where anything is you have to do your own research and when you asked they always seemed to busy or gave one word answers. I would still defintly go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: wiseChelmsford
Reviews.Content: We really could not find anything bad to say about this hotel. The location is perfect and it was great to be able to use the lovely beach for a couuple of hours every day and feel relaxed out of the city. \we never waited for more then 5 mins and also bought the 2 day tour bus ticket which was excellent value. The rooms were very clean, amazing breakfast and the evening meal allowed you to use the set menue- this was 3 lovely courses including large glass of very nice wine for 15 euroes! We stayed ln second floor and found the sea view great. Reception staff, restaurant staff very helpful. Great to have safe in room - be very careful of pick pockets - we wore flat money belts under our clothes. Drink of sangra on the rambles was 15 euroes - just take a turn off the main road and had wonderful large home made one for 3 !!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay!!”
Reviews.Author: fs1981
Reviews.Content: If someone sees this hotel just as a hotel, I don't think that he could find something bad to say about it. Clean, nice breakfast, clean rooms, great view, helpful and kind staff. For me and my friends who are young, staying at this hotel was no problem. For older people the distance from the centre could be a problem. But the bus No 41 is really convenient and only 15 mins from Plaza Catalunya (centre). I would recommend the Subway in cases such as having to use it for many stops. I would most probably stay again in this hotel despite the distance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, shame about the unfriendly reception staff..”
Reviews.Author: SafariQueen1
Reviews.Content: Just got back from spending the Easter weekend in BCN. The hotel was nice, but very average. I would put it on par with a good Premier Inn, nothing 4 star apart from the price. The reception staff were unfriendly, grumpy and to be honest not very helpful. Alex & the lounge bar staff were great and extremely hard working....well done! Best thing about the room was the power shower, but could do with a large screen as water tends to spray. Tv was dated and a serious lack of english speaking channels, however, the music channel was great to get back to the sound of the 80's to my teenager's irritation! Location is abit way out if you want to do all the sight seeing, but the 41 bus is a great option for getting into town and connecting to other routes. We went to the Nou Camp to watch the match, which takes about an hour on the metro and about the same using the buses. If you arrive without a match ticket I recommend you go directly to the stadium and purchase them at the ticket office - don't forget ID if you are paying by card. The addresses on the official website are misleading and time wasting as they are only collection points if you have already purchased online. Would we stay at this hotel again....No! Only discovered the diagonal Mar shopping Mall on the last day which is about a10-15 minute walk from the hotel. Good shops & eating options. Tram stop outside, which is covered by the travel card.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel on beach, bit of a trek to the sights”
Reviews.Author: kyliew52
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel (which we got for free using Clubcard vouchers). If we'd been paying, we would have chosen a place nearer the city, but this hotel did have its benefits. We walked along the front down to the Olympic Village on a sunny day, which was gorgeous. We had been getting the metro into town, and only discovered the 41 bus on our last day - I would definitely recommend the bus over the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all.”
Reviews.Author: greatadvisor73
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel and the breakfast, even though I didn't get it included in the price. The breakfast buffet was sensational. It was 10 euros each, but it was worth it. The bed was made daily and we got clean towels daily as well. The beach view was nice as well. I wish it had a balcony, but it was nice just as well. It had free wi-fi, even tho you need to use your cell phone to get the account activated and my cell phone did not have signal. So, the staff was able to get me set up. Also, I didnt' know that we were getting charged for using the phone even though we had a prepaid calling card. Those charges were presented to us at the end and it was like 50 euros total. I called my kids daily, sometimes twice a day. This beach is public, but, I didn't realize that there were topless women. Hint, hint. We took lots of pics!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant beach front hotel”
Reviews.Author: SouthCarolinaRecluse
Reviews.Content: When my wife and I arrived at Barceló Atenea Mar we were extremely tired from the flight. I had emailed the hotel ahead of time to inform them we wanted to upgrade our room and ask if we could pay the rate of the extended check out for an early check in. The hotel manager told us they did not offer that service, but he said he would inform the staff of our early arrival and try to help accommodate us. The taxi fare came to €37 on a Sunday, with tip included, and was a little less on the way back. Upon arrival we had to sit in the lobby for an hour and then were checked into the room, earlier than the three o’clock check in time. After five thousand miles traveled any bit of time counts. The room itself was clean and spacious for a European hotel room. Our room was on the seventh floor and the beach view was excellent. The king bed was made of two double beds, and firm, but we still slept great. The shower was the best shower I have ever had in a hotel room. Being a big tall guy, I appreciated the ability to lift the shower head and pressure enough to massage a rhino. The television was small and outdated. Half of the 19 cable channels were blurry and only 2 ½ were in English. Two news, and the half a music video channel that covered many 1980’s American hits, and odd ball varieties. Luckily I planned for this and brought a group of DVD’s for the laptop, and used Netflix streamed from the Wi-Fi. You have to send a code to your cell phone and sign up for their Wi-Fi information. We did not have a GSM network phone so we had to get the sign-in information from the front desk. When we walked into the room we had to use one of the key cards to turn the power and air on. This became a bit of a problem considering the air conditioning barely worked. The window opens, but it sucks all of the air right out. We were here in April, the room got very warm during the day, so I would hate to see how hot the room was in July. It made taking a nap in the afternoon hard at times. The refrigerator for the mini bar was also warm, and the ice machine on the first floor was busted. Buying drinks around the corner is also a better deal for € 1 v. mini bar €3. Room service works out to be a better deal than some of the restaurants at times. One night we ordered the steak and salad with cheesecake, chocolate currant and cinnamon ice cream, and three cokes for €53. That may sound expensive here, but the restaurants around the corner will run you the same amount. The breakfast buffet in the restaurant was good, but the selection gets tiring in a few days. There are a few outdoor cafes less than a block away. We ate at the Modernista café a few mornings. On the way to the subway there is a shop called Sweet Mas that any sweet tooth will enjoy. After one in the morning you will be lucky to find any food anywhere, and the breakfast buffet closes down at 10:30. Keep that in mind if you have a long night. The Poblenou station is a good 10min walk. Don’t forget to check out the Poblenou Rambla, and the graveyard is a fifteen minute walk away. Condis supermarket is on the way to the station. The bus turistica is on the corner, but I found the subway faster getting around the city. Checkout the skateboarding park near the beach I would recommend the hotel add some alarm clocks, upgrade their televisions, add a handle to the safe, and get the air conditioners in the rooms working like the air conditioners in the lobby. We had a great time and enjoyed everything, and we may go back one day if it is in the colder months.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean and a Bus Ride Away From the City Center”
Reviews.Author: my2cents2011
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Barcelo Atenea Mar based on reviews from TripAdvisor. All the reviews seemed to be pretty fair. The hotel is not close to the city center. From the airport, we took the Aerobus (5,50 euros, one way, per person) to Placa Catalunya, then caught the 41 bus (1,45 euro per person) to the hotel. The bus stop is right around the corner from the hotel. We used this bus a lot during our stay. The hotel staff was friendly and spoke english very well. The room was small as to be expected, but clean and comfortable. The only thing that was missing for me was another mirror outside the bathroom. This is just because I like to do my hair outside the bathroom to avoid the steam. (Small personal nuance). We were able to connect to the free WiFi they offered and it worked pretty good, we had no issues. I guess the iron, laptop and flat iron was a little too much and all our lights went out. We called the front desk and in less than 3 mins a staff member was there to fix it. We didn't eat in the hotel because we were there for a short time and wanted to spend as much time outside the hotel as possible. There are restaurants one block away and the ocean is 2 blocks up. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent view, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: vsrianand
Reviews.Content: I stay in this hotel everytime i go to Barcelona, which is almost 3 to4 times a year. The best thing I love about this hotel is the beach view, both the sunset and sunrise views are excellent. One could forget about everything else and gaze into the sea for hours. In summer this beach is a very active place right from 6 am till late night, you will find, people running, cycling, football matches, children playing etc., even in the cold season you will still find people going for their walks. The hotel itself is also very comfortable, a good bed, internet connection, television, breakfast with a excellent spread. The staff are courteous and even if you dont speak Spanish, they make all the effort to address all your needs. They also have a nice coffee place/ bar, nice to relax and have a drink with also access to couple of computers, TV etc.,

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: jaruprapa
Reviews.Content: There's a good mix of Pros and Cons during our stay at this hotel. Pros: large room and bath room, beach's view, really clean. fitness facilities. internet access (free) plus the possible to store the luggage before leaving. Cons: It is quite far from the Metro (10-15 min walk) . Yes there is a bus with the stops near to the hotel but it only takes us to Catalunya and we have to take another transport to get anywhere else. So basically, if you are doing a serious site seeing in town, it doens't worth to get back to the hotel and head out again for lunch/dinner. Upon our arrivals (around mid day) , the front desk sent us to a room which has already been occupied. Of course, it would have been a serious problem if someone had stayed in the room. So OK ! we changed the rooms but the lock in the room didn't work. By the time this is sorted, we lost our afternoon. So, overall, if you have a few days to spend in BCN, you better stay nearer to the city or to the Metro line. tips: would strongly advise you to get a bus map of BCN. Metro is good but buses allow you more options. You can get it from the tourist information centres which dotted around the city or get it from the transport office at Sant station. If you walk from the hotel towards Poblenou station, there are some mini marts which are good to get some nibbles and fruits or drinks. Best to go to Sagrada Familiar at the opening time. We did and by the time we left , there was a long queue outside which snaked around the church itself!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, pleasant staff, and lovely beachfront location”
Reviews.Author: SRD1982
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in October 2010 with my partner on a sightseeing trip around the city. Number one tip from me, is dont be afraid of the underground system. This hotel is located some-way from the centre of town, and quite pricey in a taxi...but is only 5-10 minutes walk from the Poblenou underground station. We bought a four day pass to use all the lines for 20Eur...which was awesome, it gets you everywhere! The hotel is really modern, the staff are all very friendly, and it is situated in a quiet part of town, across the road from an excellent beach. City centre bar prices will probably set you back around 8Eur for a pint of beer, whereas the hotel was roughly 3.50Euro. If you fancy really "pigging out" make sure you pay a visit to Dao Kaitensushi. This is an all you can eat sushi restaurantm, like 'YO Sushi' , located very close to the "Barceloneta' metro stop...it's absolutely superb, and pretty cheap to boot! (Address is Passeig Colom, 4)

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel: Some staff have a clear attitude problem though”
Reviews.Author: Buzzy123
Reviews.Content: Some of the staff are real nice but some have an "I work here and you are the inconvenient client" attitude. This went all the way from the manager, Jesus Riviera, who promised to change a terrible razor in the room that shredded parts of my face and left me bleeding for a good one and then promptly did nothing! The next day the front desk man (Alex I think?) who looked seriously overworked but very kind was left to explain and apologize. If only they had said " NO!" We won't replace the razor" but, no, the manager, in an attempt to look clever, promised a solution to get my amazement and thank you. There were other cases of aggression from tired staff at the event being held there. More than once. Its a great hotel in a beautiful location, if not some distance from the center. The metro is a good 10 mins walk away. A block south is http://www.elspeixatersdelamediterrania.com/ - a great restaurant. Breakfast at the hotel is good at 10 euros all in.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful beach front Hotel - Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: LMSScotland
Reviews.Content: Lovely stay at the Atenea Mar. Best to get floor from 7 upwards and would recommend paying the 10euro a night extra for that. Don't pay for the 30 euro upgrade because what we could see was they were promising a panoramic view but the windows were the same on each floor. Make sure you book a non smoking floor. Staff were very friendly when we needed to change rooms because someone had smoked in a non smoking room before us. Restaurant nice for breakfast each morning but v.v expensive for lunch and dinner and therefore very quiet. More a conference hotel but so beautiful to stay on the beach when you get out of the hussel and bussel of the city. Recommend getting the metro and bus ticket combo. Number 41 bus stops right outside the hotel and takes you to Catalunya square. Lovely hotel and would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Average, but good for budget traveling”
Reviews.Author: travelingERdoc
Reviews.Content: Positives: next to beach (or at least over the highway to the beach), inexpensive compared to other hotels in the area, ~10 minute walk to conference center, friendly staff, room was clean. Negatives: at least a 10-15 minute walk (which is pretty far in the city) to public transportation. The local area is really nothing special aside from the beach, there are not too many good restaurants/shops etc. within walking distance (really not any at all, in my opinion). The internet does not work in the rooms (I heard several other guests complain about this). There are only a few channels on the TV (and only CNN is in English). Overall, if you're traveling on a budget and dont plan on spending too much time in your room (which you really shouldnt be anyway), its not a bad deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: karenacheryl
Reviews.Content: Great location right on the beach. Beware that it s not near the metro station about 10 minutes walk. Our room looked right out onto the ocean, great a/c, rooms nice and clean with friendly helpful staff and free wifi. There are lovely little cafe's near by for a morning coffee. If you like to party and don;t want to venture into the city, take a cab to Port Olympica (by the golden fish) about 5 euro's. There are a group of about 5 restaurants which after midnight have clubs, free entrance. Finally, make sure you purchase a T-10 ticket from the train station for approx 8 euro's as it makes you 10 travel rides and you can share the ticket.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: TravelingOYEster
Reviews.Content: I was looking for some beach time, and that is what I got! I spent 5 nights at the hotel. It was clean, freezing (great AC) and comfortable. My room was super small, but it was just me so I didn't mind (I got the end room with a view of the ocean - so no complaints here). I took the bus into the city which was super easy. I also took the subway which was a far walk from the hotel - but also easy to figure out. There are some cute restaurants about a 10 minute walk from the beach. Also, there is a shopping center about 10 minute walk where I got some breakfast, lunch foods and some water (as there was a small fridge in the room). The only downside was the internet as wifi wasn't working too well. It was only available in the lobby. By day 3, someone gave me a cord to try using the internet in my room - then it was fine (even though on day 2 someone told me it wouldn't work). Anyhow, it was a nice stay and I would definitely go back if I wanted some relaxing beach time vs. being smack in the busy city.

Reviews.Title: “Just next to the public beach”
Reviews.Author: rocking_pony
Reviews.Content: Pros: great breakfast, clean, very close to the public beach, quite big and comfortable bathroom, quiet. Cons: small room (we had standard room, there was no place to put our luggage), far from the city center, quite a long walk from metro stations, the Internet connection was rather poor. Despite of all the above cons, I would recommend this hotel, especially for business purposes but also for leisure (beach). It wasn't bad but one can demand a little bit more for this price and standard.

Reviews.Title: “Well, it's à hotel...?”
Reviews.Author: SwedishClaes
Reviews.Content: Hotel was just fine if you take it for what it is - a hotel and not a palace. AC worked very well and so did the wifi. In the informationbrochures in the room it says you have to pay extra to get wifi and access to the safe, but that is not the case. We never tried the restaurant, nor the breakfast since it seemed pricey. But we would like to strongly recommend the Rambla del Poblenou as another rewiever did - a really cosy little street with lots of charm and lots of wonderful Tapas-bars and restaurants! The street is located just a couple of blocks to the right when standing with the hotel behind you and the sea in front of you. We bought a two-day pass on the Bus turistica which stops just outside the hotel - a great way to move around Barcelona and at the same time see the city. Othervise taxis are relatively cheap. We paid just over 30 € oneway Barcelona airport to the hotel in rush hour, and that's pretty cheap compared to the hazzle and extra time buses and trains would result in. On sundays "everything is closed" we were told, but that's not true. The Maremagnum shopping mall in Port Vell is open on sundays, and the cab fair was about 7 € from the hotel. All in all we had a GREAT holiday in Barcelona, and the city is very beautiful and fascinating!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: Green-eyed-77
Reviews.Content: Across the street to public beach. one 20 min bus to La Rambla and downtown We used the hotel after a Cruise. It was perfect for the few days we stayed there....

Reviews.Title: “Excelellent Location”
Reviews.Author: kamakoti
Reviews.Content: Great location facing the beach. Hotel manager not caring for customer concerns

Reviews.Title: “reasonable for the price but dont think i'd stay again”
Reviews.Author: no1smiles2000
Reviews.Content: for the price this hotel was in a good location for our needs, walking distance to the exhibition centre we were using. We had sea view rooms, reasonably spacious, nice bathrooms. We were at the front of the hotel & it was extremely noisy because of the main road outside. ALl i can say is that i stayed in a budget hotel on a main road in the UK & didnt get so much noise. it kept me awake at night. Communial spaces were a bit plain, very dark colours etc. Staff were reasonably friendly and helpful. Hope this helps people, i think a back room without sea view i would have had a better stay. Free wiifi was good but slow

Reviews.Title: “Pack any valuables in the safe when you leave the room”
Reviews.Author: HongKongHomer
Reviews.Content: While the rooms are nice and the staff pleasant enough, you should consider other options before booking at the Barceló. We were at the Atanea Mar in Barcelona and had $140 cash in US Dollars pilfered from a hidden spot in our bags. OK, I know we should have put it in the safe. The jewelry and passports went in the safe, but after not sleeping on the flight over, I was a little delirious. What made this clever is that I had a total of US$375 in the envelope and would not have noticed had I not counted it. After it was stolen, the clerk determined that the room was only accessed by the housekeeper. I spent 4 hours over the course of 2 days making a police report only to have the manager of the hotel shrug his shoulders and say "what can we do? It is not our legal responsibility." And to add insult to injury, they did not give us our requested wake up call on the morning of our flight departure. Their excuse was they didn't have a record of the clerk making a notation. Thank you captain obvious. The alarm clock on the cell phone saved us. If you value your possessions, and want to make your flight out of town, DO NOT STAY AT THE BARCELÓ ATANEA MAR. While the staff will be pleasant, your possessions may not be safe. And bring an alarm clock.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for a long vacation”
Reviews.Author: fetitavesela
Reviews.Content: the hotel is located right in front of the marbella beach, right across the street. if you want a vacation that includes visiting, shopping, relaxing, the hotel is perfectly located. even it is a little far from the city it is easy to get to Catalunya by using the bus 41 that stop in front of hotel. (it takes approx. 20 min) also there is a metro station( we used poblenou) wich is located at 10 minutes walk. use T10 ticket. the room is ok, we had sea view from our room, from 7th floor. the room was cleaned every day. we didn't served breakfast at hotel, because it seemed quite expensive ( 15 euro). we preffered a bar near hotel, also for the morning coffee. if you want shopping there is a little mall diagonal mar, 10 min walk from the hotel, but i reccomend to shop from city center. also the hotel has a free sauna and gym for the guests.

Reviews.Title: “the meaning of beauty”
Reviews.Author: AbouElsheour
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel in front of nova mar bella beach , highly recomended if you stay in Barcelona for more than 3 days during spring or summer time , a little bite out of city but bus 41 from next block can take you to catalunya sq. nice sea view , very good service , bad wi fi connection , nearest supermarket Mercadona little bit far , very good bargin for 62 Euro per double

Reviews.Title: “Not representative for Barceló chain”
Reviews.Author: Zecco
Reviews.Content: You're not in Japan and therefore ratings for service and friendliness on latino-scales always tend to be subjective and mostly depend on if you are good looking. But let's stick to facts; if you have been to other Hotels of Barcelò Chain, this hotel is definitely not their flag-ship. Old TV's, poor A/C, clogged sinks, room categories with virtually no window, far from public transportation & movida.

Reviews.Title: “Plesant stay”
Reviews.Author: Next40
Reviews.Content: Hotel very clean and nice location opposite beach but about 15mins away from nearest metro station, however number 41 bus came every 15mins but takes about 20mins to city centre. Breakfast ok but hot buffet not hot. Staff in restraurant at breakfast rude and unhelpful. Reception staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very Chiq and good beach location”
Reviews.Author: john-suffolk2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a four night break pre christmas, taxi to the hotel was 30 euros, we were given a realy nice roon overlooking the sea. Rooms are one of the cleanest i have stayed in , bright ,airy and modern. The fixed price menu is excellant and the food quality, first class, we ate in twice. Staff are very helpful and gave us some tips on were to visit . The metro is a short walk 5mins and the location is just far enough out of the city centre to avoid all the hassle and noise of the city centre. Reception looked afater are bags on the check out day and told us were to catch the airport bus to save some money if we come agai we will certainly stay here

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel without air conditioning in Barcelona?”
Reviews.Author: Iscand
Reviews.Content: It was october. Barcelona was still rather warm in that period and there was no air conditioning available in the rooms. I had to keep the small window open during the night. Fortunately the noisy street was not a problem for me. I hated that place... The hotel is not conveniently located, I would say. The closest metro station is at a 15 minutes walk away from the hotel. Not really annoying, in the end...

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Resapo
Reviews.Content: It's not in city centre,but it didn't bother me.A Hairdryer was really crap.Would never recomend to eat in the restaurant-overpriced and not tasty at all (i'm not fussy with food and i was very hungry,so the food must have been really bad if even concidering circumstances i did't like it)

Reviews.Title: “Yikes-will this place last despite the bad economy?”
Reviews.Author: Dragonlady15
Reviews.Content: They say that the only places that will thrive Despite a bad economy will be the ones with great customer service ... which I guess means this hotel should be shutting doors down there soon. Right? My bad experience started in the USA, when I called the 1-800 line for Barcelo hotels to ask about how many beds the "family" suite we had booked would have. The hotel operator had the nerve to tell me she does not know, and that I should call USA directly to ask? huh? Is not that HER job??? After I yelled a bit, she made the call and got me an answer. We showed up at the hotel, Which is actually quite nice, and neatly kept. It is right across from the ocean, but I think it is a bit of a stretch to say it is across from a beach-it is not really a "beach" area. It is not convenient at all to public transit-allow 20 minutes to walk to the nearest metro stop, and an another 20 minutes to get into the city center. Assume that if you have any luggage, you will have to take a taxi to and from the airport, Which Will be about 35 euros each way (without traffic). .... Then there is the lousy hotel service. We have been here 4 days so far, and 3 of those days the wifi service has been broken. Which means I am spending lots of money on accessing wifi on my iphone, I have a job where I simply need to have wifi access to check my emails. Oh yeah-then, we tried to order room service, and got our food two hours later after multiple phone calls and more yelling. Lots of other small details lend to my labeling of this hotel as a "2-star" place. They give you shampoo, conditioner or lotion but not. The televisions look 20 years old and have very few channels. There appears to be no alarm clock, no coffee maker, and no easy way to get hot water from the restaurant when they are closed (which seems to be most of the time). We have 2 days left at this hotel, and I must confess, I can not wait to leave. My suggestion? find a hotel that is in the central part of the city. Trust me, you will thank me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre-Cruise Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: snne
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect hotel if you just need a place to sleep the night before a cruise! We had 3 in one room (with a roll away at no extra cost) and 2 in the other-which is hard to do in Europe! The hotel was modern, clean, comfortable beds and very helpful staff. They booked a dinner reservation for us and had a taxi for 5 waiting in under 15 minutes! This location was perfect for us-close to the port, safe and quiet!

Reviews.Title: “motel, trying to be a hotel, stuck in a 70 s time warp.”
Reviews.Author: englishcatalan
Reviews.Content: Booked deluxe room, dont be fooled by the photos, mini bar broken, aircon worse than useless, furniture in poor, state, covered in deep scratches, constant traffic noise all night due to cheap double glazing. Fresh fruit for breakfast was good, the rest wasnt worth trying. Pay the little bit extra and book in city centre. Luckily only booked for 1 night

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel, Bargain price”
Reviews.Author: jimilia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and was quite happy with it. Clean, modern hotel. To access the beach you cross over one road, then there is a mid section approx 30 metres wide, and then you cross over another road. Kinda like a dual carriage way, but not as busy. No sign of the nudist beach! Internet connection was quite slow, but it was free! The beds were quite comfy, and the hotel was very clean. It took us 30 minutes to walk into town, which was a nice stroll along the beach. There is a bus stop just outside of the hotel, and you can get a travel card which is valid for 10 journeys which didnt cost very much (approx 6E's if my memory serves me right). There wasn't an awful lot to do in the evenings, there are a couple of restaurants nearby, and a chemist, but down on the beach they have bars which you can sit at. The drinks at these places were approx 4E for a pint of beer, 2E for a glass of coke, you could also get sandwiches etc from them. I would stay in this hotel again for the price we paid (50E night).

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money! Best hotel of the trip!”
Reviews.Author: myboyfriendsanerd
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights and it was by far the best hotel we stayed in on our trip. We paid $150AU for a deluxe room and it was huge, clean and modern. We were lucky and had the top floor and a wonderful view of the sea but it appears most rooms should have a good view as there are no buildings in front of it. The staff were also very good and upon checkin we were quite a few hours early but they allowed us to check in anyways which was great. By far one of the bigest hotel rooms I have stayed in and it had everything we could want (except a Iron but most places these days seem to charge). I nice plasma, double vanity in the bathroom, a shower AND a shower/bath, marble bathroom, safe, room service, good curtains to keep the light out in the morning etc etc OH and the best bit... THE BED! It was huge (king) and comfy. As some have mentioned in their reviews this hotel is a little out of the main part of the city but it is still walkable (if you like a decent walk) and there is a metro 5-10mins away so really its not that bad. and there is a nice big shopping centre with all the fashions shops 10mins walk away for the ladies! (it was my first stop). Would recommend to anyone! (for the best rate have a look on some of the discount websites like hotelclub).

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean modern room!”
Reviews.Author: latanacio
Reviews.Content: The Barcelo Atenea Mar is situated a little outside of the main downtown of Barcelona, but it is close to both bus and subway stops and the tourist bus stops at its door. Its location across the street from the beach is convenient and we always felt safe when departing or arriving on foot. The room we had was a corner one that had views of the Mediterranean, as well as of the city proper and the mountains surrounding. It was large, the bathroom was amazing and everything was clean, modern and well kept. We would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: jac247
Reviews.Content: Can't fault this hotel for use by a large group. Spacious enough rooms, clean. Only downside is that not strictly central to Barcelona, and you'll be paying a EUR5-10 cab fare to travel to and from many attractions. Still, four of you in a taxi, it isn't expensive - especially when you can get rooms for EUR85 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Dont go for business!”
Reviews.Author: CLBee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not geared up for business meetings despite having conference/meeting rooms. Audio visual equipment had to be brought in from else where, no flexibility on coffee breaks/ lunchtimes, staff not helpful,. They cleared away our meeting rooms a day early - saying they thought we had left! Sitting area/bar area very small - if all meeting rooms ere being used then it would have been very crowded. Much more geared up to tourist guests but even then not very welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Great for beach & city, but not easy reach of city”
Reviews.Author: Fordee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a family with 10 & 15 year old children. Wanted a hotel close to Beach, but within reach of the city - this hotel is just that, though a little further from the city than we would have liked. Hotel is a typical large, conference hotel with zero atmosphere, clean rooms and a small Jacuzzi, Sauna and steam room. Gym is quite well appointed. Took ages to be served at the bar, two free internet computers in the lobby, but free WiFi in the room. Staff try to help, but do not trust their advice... Sent us to eat on the beach on arrival - dressed in jeans etc, and expensive. There are 4 or 5 small bars/tapas places two minutes down the road which are OK for a drink and snack. Supermarkets within easy walk are Diagonal Mar Auchan & Shopping mall type place, or explore behind the hotel turning left then zig zag for even cheaper and closer. Metro quite a walk, so catch the 41 bus almost outside the hotel. Arrived at Barcelona Girona Airport and took bus outside to the city - took 90 minutes and cost 12 Euros each for a single trip. On arriving at Barcelona L'Arc de Triumph station, bought metro tickets (but a T10 at a machine for 7.60 euro and gives you 10 trips for buses & metro which are designed to be shared). If you have the time, and are not tired then do this, but hotel is quite a walk from the metro - get a taxi if with young children or tired. OR - even better - walk to Arc de Triumph (3 minutes), and catch a 41 bus which drops you almost outside the Hotel.) You can pay on the bus. Beaches - walk further towards Port Olympia (right along the beach) for a nicer family place and loungers/parasols ( 5 euros each per parasol or lounger until 6pm - attendant will find you. ) This hotel does what it says on the tin, but no more.

Reviews.Title: “poor, unfriendly service”
Reviews.Author: xmomx
Reviews.Content: the staff is very unfriendly and unhelpful. we experienced several days of getting no towels, one day of having no water and one day having no elevator service (we were on the 8th floor). the staff neither advised, assisted or answered any of our questions with these problems. we do not speak spanish, so language was a huge barrier for us. we could not get assistance from the staff as to how to get to different attractions in the city. we mostly just walked as we also had the experience of getting stuck & lost on the bus for 1hr 1/2 . there were a couple of nice, helpful employees but for the most part we found them rude. the breakfast buffet was good but we were at this hotel for 2 weeks and the menu was the same everyday. we loved the location of this hotel. there was a great view and we spent most mornings on the beaches which is only a 5 minute walk from the hotel. the air conditioning and internet service worked very well in our room and the bed & pillows were very comfortable. so to sum it up, we loved the location but hated the service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sanantonioscott
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at this hotel with my wife and two teenage sons. We had two rooms since they don't allow more than 3 to a room. The rooms were very clean and the beds were very nice and comfortable. We had a nice view of the ocen from our room. The bathrooms are fantastic as many other reviewers have said, very roomy with a nice shower and plumbing fixtures. Free wireless internet was spotty from the room, but worked perfect in the lobby. They had two complimentory computers in the lobby, but they stayed busy. The plugs in the rooms are the standard European version so remember to bring your converters. Our flight from the US arrived at 8:30am so we took a taxi to the hotel arriving around 10:00 a.m. after clearing customs and locating a taxi. My brother-in-law also traveled with us and we learned that the taxis in Barcelona only hold a maximum of 4 passengers, so we took two from the airport. The Taxi ride for one cab ran us around $50 U.S. The hotel was full upon arrival and told us they would store our luggage behind the counter but couldn't offer us our rooms until 3:00 p.m., which was understandable. We had read reviews about the Diagonal Mar Mall not too far from the Hotel so we walked there for lunch. It is a very nice multi-story mall which includes a super market and many dining options, however most of them don't open until later in the day. The locals eat later lunches and much later dinners that we are accustomed to in the U.S. The McDonalds and other fast food places were open though so we had no problem finding a place to eat. The prices were much more reasonable at the food court at the mall than most restaurants we spotted nearby. Several reviewers said that the Chinese food at the restuarant next to the hotel was good and inexpensive. We at there one evening and thought it was pretty gross. Most of us had sweet and sour chicken which looked like they had put preformed chicken balls in some red sauce and added a can of fruit cocktail, NASTY. Also they don't even serve rice with their dinner entrees, rice has to be ordered separately which makes it not so cheap in the end. Don't bother with this place. Many of the restaurants you see near the hotel have the same signs on their sidewalks that have pictures of various plates of food that all look the same. I think they all have some sort of "frozen" entrees they buy they buy from the same supplier and just pop in an oven. For example we ordered Pizzas at one of them near the hotel and asked if we could remove the Anchovies from the pizza and they said no. Ha! Don't bother with these places either. They are perfect to stop and have a local beer and rest for a while, but not really for a decent dinner. We used the bus that stops on the Hotel corner to take us to Las Rambles our second day and it went smoothly and easy. However we got on the same number bus to come home and obviously we should have asked more questions because it ran a very long route and then made us pay again before it finally got us to the hotel an hour and a half later. It was a nice sight seeing tour though. The next day we took the subway back and it was much faster and cheaper since we only had to pay once! We learned to ask the price at the sandwich shops around Las Rambles before you pick one out. We stopped at a "chain" sandwich shop that has all of the sandwiches ready and sitting out.
