I pointed at two small sandwiches and my wife grabbed a can of coke from their refridgerator and the guy could tell we were tourists so after he heated them up he charged me 24 Euros! A couple of blocks away, we saw another location of same sandwich shop chain and I asked the prices and learned that the price should have been 12 Euros. Oh well, live and learn. Barcelona is a lovely city and the architecture is just amazing. Gaudi's works are not to be missed!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to the beach”
Reviews.Author: lillianLimaPeru
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stayed at this hotel. Teh beach is accross the street, which is very convenient, only they do not have beach towels. Parking places are at the same building, ath the breakfast buffett is very good. They have a real nice staff, friendly and helpfull. I would return to this hotel no doubt about it. Lillian

Reviews.Title: “convenient, close to the beach”
Reviews.Author: BenedicteOslo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Barcelo Atenea Mar for a week and had a great time there. We are a couple with a 16-year old girl ( my niece). She had her own room next to us, and had a splendid time! Our room had a small window with a sea view and larger windows facing the shore and other buildings along the roads above the beaches. The only problem was our aircondition that did not work if the window wasn't open. In the beginning it did 't work at all, but the reception had someone to come and fix it. The difference between the nabouring rooms was enormous. Hers was chilly and rather cold all the time and ours was cold at night and hot when we came back in the evening. We enjoyed the breakfast twice. It's rather expencive and since my niece doesn't eat much, we bought a little bread, chease and ham and had our little bit of food in our room before we departed for what we were doing that day. The hotel is very convenient when it comes to enjoying the sun, taking long swims in the wonderful clean ocean, or taking the bus into the center of the city! The bus Turistic stops almost right outside the hotel, and the 41 bus next to it! Clean and nice and friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “The service ruined it.”
Reviews.Author: Anthony6811-5
Reviews.Content: Even though, as of this writing, it has been just over three years since my wife and I stayed at this hotel it still sticks out in our mind for the bad service. The service was the worst hotel service we have ever experienced in our travels so far in North America, Western Europe and East Asia! When we arrived and came to the front desk to check in we were ignored for a 5 minutes or so by the staff while they did absolutely nothing. Finally they took notice and took another 5 minutes to get us our room assignment and key while looking at us and talking to us in an angry tone as if we had done something wrong. We had specifically booked a non-smoking room when we made our reservations using Travelocity, but when we got to the room it reeked of cigarette smoke and caused an asthma induced coughing fit within a couple minutes That was really too bad because the room itself was well furnished, decorated, seemed bigger than a standard hotel room, and had a great view of the beach. After we trekked back down to the front desk ,and waited another 5 or more minutes for no good reason, we had to deal with the same rude front desk staff person and she kept insisting we did not request a non-smoking room and told us no other room was available and we would have to check back in another 30 minutes to an hour. At the point we just couldn't take it anymore and started giving the front desk staff person a piece of our mind and within a couple of minutes a non-smoking room magically became available. We went up to it and were disappointed that it was not quite as well appointed as our original room and had a view of other hotels and buildings instead of the ocean--but at least it did not smell of smoke and so there was no need to fear of an asthma attack from it. If we had to do it all over again we would have just called up Travelocity and made them fix it, I don't know why we didn't think of that at the time. We would probably not stay at that hotel again because our experience with the staff was so bad and we wouldn't want to tip fate again. Thankfully, apart from our lodgings there our trip was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel, amazing city!”
Reviews.Author: LondonBmw
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from Barcelona. We were looking for a hotel on the beach front, which was also within a reasonable distance of public transport which could get us in to the city swiftly. This hotel is perfect for both purposes. As many of the other reviews have indicated, the hotel is in front of the beach. There is a Metro station (Selve de Mar) a 10 minute walk away which can get you in to the city within 10 - 15 minutes. The Metro is cheap and very efficient, with airconditioned carriages - perfect in the hot summer months. The hotel itself is great value. It's not super luxurious, but it is very clean and accommodating. We had a fantastic time and the hotel was a great value base for our mix of lounging on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4* hotel anymore, probably 5 years ago it was”
Reviews.Author: Anca_18
Reviews.Content: We reserved a superior double room, but we received something that looked as a single room, the bed was 1.40, very small room. Be aware not to accept rooms that are 102, 202, 302, 402…these are the smallest rooms. The design is outdated, looks old. It is clean but everything looks “tired”. The personnel is bored, you can’t find maps in the reception. Be aware at the mini bar, you can find beer that expired more than 1 year ago at a very high price. In front of the hotel is written that you can rent bicycles, you have to ask the reception, but when you ask you will discover that is not working this service and they are sending you in an another location far away. It is far away from the city center, around half an hour by bus (41, near the hotel). The breakfast …you should skip, very expensive for what they offer. Indeed the hotel is close to the beach, but you can find better hotels in the area if you really want to stay near the beach. I recommend the area around Diagonal Mar Commercial Center, more options to go in the city, very modern and quite area comparing with the city center, very good hotels in the area and also close to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dazzer11
Reviews.Content: my husband took me away for my 40 th birthday for a 3 night break we were going to stay in the town gosh glad we didnt to busy, it was a great hotel good location right near the sea front with good views over looking the beach, clean room good kingsize beds nice bathroom good choice for breakfast try to request seaview room as if you get back room you can upgrade to seaview room but with a charge, good transport links to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Barcelona!!”
Reviews.Author: CocoLoco69
Reviews.Content: It was a tough decision trying to choose where to stay for our first trip to Barcelona. This hotel was a good choice. It is plain but satisfactory as we only are there to sleep and shower. Loved the closet/cupboard space by the door. We had a room facing the sea, the view was lovely but.....the downside is a major road is on that side with high traffic volume on it 24/7. The window is large and opens. Next time we would take the city view for quiet. The hotel itself was quiet, all our minor issues were dealt with promptly, room was hot, no a/c turned on yet in the building. Hotel lounge and restaurant pricey. Lots of other little restaurants in the neighborhood. It is about a 10 min walk to Diagonal Mar shopping center, bus and train close by, tourista bus stops close by when that route is operating in the high season. The hot tub was cold. The neighborhood is quiet and nice to go to after being in Ramblas and the other areas of the city. It was a positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: LuisaM
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not clean, the room was too small, the carpet, the walls were derty. Bad service. Poor customer service. I do not recomend this hotel to anyone. And I don't know how this hotel is rated 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Impressively good at the price”
Reviews.Author: GlobetrottersSweden
Reviews.Content: I was not expecting this good hotel at the price we paid and at this location. The room was clean with modern interior. The reception was very service minded. It is 5-10 minutes walk to metro and there is a bus stop close by. With the frequency and pricing of the metro trains, I'd say that staying here is better than spending the same amount on a much worse hotel in the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel by the Mediterranean”
Reviews.Author: eurostays
Reviews.Content: This hotel can have a '5', but after staying in so many other hotels with a balcony overlooking the sea as part of our travelling escapade, I would say the only thing missing from Barcelo Hotel was a balcony. Even the hotel next to it I noticed as walking by had a balcony on all the seafront rooms. Barcelona itself is expensive, and if you don't eat more than one item with a cup of coffee, don't pay the extra 10 EUR/day to add to your hotel cost. There were 4 perfectly good restaurants literally one block down on the seafront side of the hotel, 2 of which served excellent breakfast for less than 5 EUR. Service is what impressed me. I noticed the room policy was if you had laundry, to place it in the bag provided and leave it on your bed and you would receive it after 5pm the enext day, but that same day service cost double the regular price. I was impressed to find that not only was my laundry returned to me the same day, but there was no extra cost for doing so. The hotel staff was very professional, spoke English well, and was very helpful, even making a phone call for us to the Bull ring for information on a Bullfight. Rooms were cleaned by staff every day, and even the bath looked like a brand new one with everything back in its place, or replaced, as the day you checked in. So it was a great bang for the buck. If you want to get into town, just ask the staf which metro to take and they know. It was the best transportation for us, and very affordable. The rooms were more than adequate size, spacious closet, good wine bar selection, and easy to operate phone with guide. Variety of services were excellent, leaning more towards that of a 5 Star hotel. Internet connection was very poor in the rooms at the time I was there, but go to the lobby and you don't even need a code login, you just click right on to the internet for free.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel that seems like it could easily be made above average”
Reviews.Author: synaptoneurosome
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just spent 3 nights at the Barcelo Atenea Mar, and for the price we paid and the level of quality and service we've experienced in other major European cities, I have to say we were expecting more. The room was pretty average, with neutral decor and one large crinkled poster framed on the wall. Our refrigerator seemed to have issues, in that it smelled quite rotten and didn't keep our champagne cold, but as long as we didn't open it too much, that was okay. It would have been nice to have in-room coffee & tea service. This seems like a small change that would be easy to implement and would make one's stay more comfortable. We tried ordering peppermint tea two mornings in a row from room service (once in English, once in Spanish), and both times, we were brought black tea. Something was lost in translation there... There were two quite exceptional things about the room. The bathroom was great - very spacious with an *excellent* shower (which did result in a slightly wet bathroom after use, as another reviewer commented on). The bed was also fantastic- absolutely huge and very, very comfortable. In addition, the window with panoramic sea views was brilliant as well. As we were on a high floor in the hotel, it made for excellent people watching. Housekeeping did an excellent job keeping the room looking tidy, but we were a little disappointed to see that the champagne glasses we had brought with us were cleared away by the housekeeping staff after our first day at the hotel. We called reception and requested 2 more to be brought up, which they kindly did. Those were cleared away the next day too, so when we requested 2 more glasses on our final evening there, we thought it would be no problem to just borrow 2 more hotel glasses. However, this time we ended up calling 3 times over the course of an hour, and were told (by the third time) by a very curt individual at the front desk that they were very busy and we would have to wait until they had a moment to bring our glasses. This was at 6PM. Our glasses never arrived that evening. A bit of a poor show, if you ask me. In general, the staff at the front desk seemed hit or miss in terms of helpfulness and general interest in customer satisfaction. I must commend one gentleman in particular, who seemed to go out of his way to help me relocate a ring I mistakenly left in the restroom off the restaurant on the ground floor, and for that I am incredibly grateful. Other individuals seemed to convey a too-cool attitude or were just downright unfriendly. A little staff training might go a long way in the customer service department. Overall, I'd say it was a pretty average hotel. If you can find a rate for less than EUR100/night, I'd recommend considering staying there. As is, we were paying slightly more than £100/night, and I don't think it was worth that cost. But of course, Barcelona is amazing, so if you're not spending much time at the hotel anyways, then maybe it doesn't need to wow you....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Wacky-Scientist
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just outside Barcelona but with good metro links and a great walk along the shore front. Excellent friendly staff, great rooms with wonderful sea views. Breakfast OK, bar good. The cost per room per night was excellent for a 4* hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: THECLEVERADVISOR
Reviews.Content: Excellent value. Great view. Cozy rooms. Good room service. Friendly staff. will be back.

Reviews.Title: “oooops....still Cool (not Barcelo Sants)”
Reviews.Author: gogirlie3
Reviews.Content: “Cool!” Barcelo Sants gogirlie3 West CoastDec 2, 2008 I think it was booked thru travelocity or expedia. not sure - whoever american airlines uses. ANYWAY. Great little place away from tourist central but with a great view of the beach (across the blvd). We enjoyed it. The young women at reception were pleasant, helpful and attractive. The guys weren't helping the business much - terse, snobby, tired of their jobs. We even tried to butcher their language while communicating (oh, maybe that was it - our Catalan was so bad we might have accidently said something wrong - sorry, we tried, this was our first time). The restaurant was really great with excellent Ports and desserts. They were very friendly and understanding of our late hours coming in after a day of touring, hungry. the service was just right and added to our enjoyment. And we even got to take our pic with a Spanish futbal star who was staying there. would always go back. A little hard to find at first, but you can get there via the train from the airport(cheapest way -get a multiday pass) you'll just have a 5-10 minute walk from the nearest station. parts of the neighborhood look like they could be sketchy after dark. Like all cities-night wouldn't be the time to walk alone. Beds were comfortable and good sized. Room was very clean, housekeeping generally friendly and flexible, in-room safe, amenities were nice. There was a conference and we really didn't notice any noise from conference goer's partying. We would go back.

Reviews.Title: “You must stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Aussietraveller81
Reviews.Content: Good Points * Clean and Stylish rooms. * Views of beautiful beach. * 5 min walk to beach - a lovely clean beach! * Free unlimited internet in the lobby (2 computers). * Room service was divine * Food in lobby * Bus to the city stops right outside * Friendly and helpful staff Bad points * 20 min bus ride to the city (although we much preferred to stay by the beach so it was ok). * Not many things around here like supermarket or laundrymat * Long walk to the closest metro stop

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel in beach area”
Reviews.Author: jeancan
Reviews.Content: Booked with 1800hotels.ie.Great value.a bit out from city centre in village built for Olympics. Spacious, quiet, clean. Dinner EXCELLENT VALUE, superb food, Menu 19euro impossible to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, fab beach location.”
Reviews.Author: Jensem
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and would def recommend it. Room wasn't ready for check in as we arrived well before recommended check in time of 3pm but we were told we could change and freshen up in the hotel gym, which is small but adequate. Location is 2 mins walk to the nearest beach and around 15 mins bus ride into the city centre. Got a great value delicious 3 course meal in the hotel restaurant. Buffet breakfast was also delicious and they had a yummy chocolate cake that you could help yourself to!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, great view!”
Reviews.Author: jennid1980
Reviews.Content: This hotel was right across the street from a beach. It was about a 10-15 minute walk to Port Olympic, and about a 5 Euro cab ride to La Rambla. I loved the location! As for cleanliness, it was extremely clean, and the hotel decor was fresh and new. The staff were reasonably friendly and parking was available for 15 euros a night.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Hasper
Reviews.Content: It's a big hotel, very clean and nice, location wise is perfect, next to one of the best beaches [Marbella] in Barcelona [there are nice beach parties Weekend nights as well] and bus 41 takes you in 10-15 minutes to the Barcelona city center. it lacks character and a personal service if that's what you are after.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Bad Location”
Reviews.Author: pdinu
Reviews.Content: Barcelo Atenea Mar is a great hotel. It is very modern, faces the Mediterranean, free internet cafe and close to a bus stop for easy access to the inner city. we had no problem whatsoever with the hotel, but it could have been a little better if the hotel was more in the city.

Reviews.Title: “great weekend breakaway”
Reviews.Author: Alicam
Reviews.Content: This was a great success. I had booked the weekend break via teletext holidays (internet) on the Thursday at 23.00hrs and on the flight on the next day at 09.00!! I had no time to check alternative accommodation therefore was a bit unsure about what to expect. A huge relief when I found the hotel was great. I'm fussy but I couldn't praise this better. Booking in took 1 minute max! Booking out 1 minute max! The hotel is relatively new, built and designed with the businessman in mind - close to the conference centre. Its minimalist and trendy. though is so close to the beach - holiday makers will also use it for convenience to the beach and good transport links to the city - No 41 bus The rooms are average size, ours over looked the main road and over to the beach. Black out curtains are in the room as the rooms are east facing and very bright in the early morning sun. Towels changed daily, the place was gleeming. Complimentary toiletries range from the normal shampoo etc to comb, toothbrush etc. It's a non smoking hotel and therefore smells really cleans and fresh Breakfasts are great - huge selection of freshly prepared fruits cereals, croissants, meats/ cheeses and hot foods - buffet style - so well worth the B&B booking we had organised. The Zen Room - is the gym which is accessed via the roasting hot under ground carpark. Its unstaffed and has little, if non, air conditioning so be prepared to sweat! The steam room and sauna were great to relax in after a day sightseeing however the jacuzzi was running with cold water - hmmm.. couldn't quite manage that!!! Took the Bus Turistic around the city to get an over view of what was where. The hop on - hop off approach is great and you can swap between any of the three routes ( blue, red or green - blue is best for main city centre sights) to get where you want to go. Be careful though, our bus stopped half way around the planned route as it was finished at 21.00 but we weren't told on boarding! So we had to scarper to another route to get back to the hotel! This hotel is not near the city centre so if you don't like having to walk after a night out this may not be the place for you I would definitely stay here if I was coming back to Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “wonderful honeymoon getaway”
Reviews.Author: apaohio
Reviews.Content: We went to barcelona for our honeymoon and stayed at this hotel because of the price and pictures. It is perfect for a honeymoon if you just want to get away. it was right across the street from a fairly quiet beach, minutes away from a small mall and right next door to a wonderful chinese restaurant. we wanted to do touristy things too, so we got a 5 day pass for the tourist bus lines which picks you up relatively close to the hotel. we got to see all of the amazing attractions of barcelona and just got a trip to town the days we didn't want to go site-seeing. it is 20-30 min from the airport but really not that far from the city center via bus. everyone in barcelona is so nice and helpful and so many people speak broken english. there is an amazing tapas bar and a wonderful sushi joint in the main plaza circle in town. everyday in barcelona was so awesome, especially since the hotel and its staff are just so nice. they were really accomodating. we initially had a room facing the city and switched to get one facing the ocean. the street is quiet and overall it was a grand experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but not in the city center”
Reviews.Author: Jenan2000
Reviews.Content: The main reason to stay at Barcelo atenea mar hotel is to attend a 2 days conference which was held in this hotel. It is a very modern hotel facing the sea. I was given a great corner room in the 11th floor ( number 1113 )...It has a great great great view. To the left side is the beach and to the right side you can see the segrada famillia and the tower. Internet is free in the hotel and there are two laptops in the cyper cafe in the lobby. The staff are very friendly and speak good English. This hotel is not in the city center but there is a mall called Diagonal mar which is only 10 minutes walking from the hotel and it has everything you need and there are many restaurants and a big supermarket. The area is very safe and not isolated. If you want to go to Plaza catalonia in the city center take bus 41 and there is a bus stop just outside the hotel's door. Never think of taking Traveller cheques with you as they are not used in Barcelona and even can't be cashed in many banks....There is only one place called Interchange in La Rambla where you can cash them with a charge of 2.5%.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: cosmicgirl1978
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as it was a cheaper option than others more centrally located. Because it was a short walk to the metro, getting around Barcelona wasn't a problem. It was around a 20 minute walk to Port Olympic. We had an inexpensive cab ride to the airport. Nearby was a lovely park, a mall and the beach (it was a little cold to spend time on it however). The room wasn't huge, but very nicely decorated,stylish, comfortable and clean. We ate in the hotel's restaurant once, the food was great; I had the nicest cod I've ever eaten! I would really recommend this hotel as a base to explore Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good for beach, not too bad for city if you're willing to travel!”
Reviews.Author: mezza10
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night at the end of a three night stay in Barcelona. For the first two nights we stayed in Hostal Goya near Placa Catalunya. The Atenea Mar is perfect for a beach holiday and good for those who want to mix the beach with the city - as long as you don't mind a bit of a travel back to the hotel after a days sightseeing. We caught a bus from Placa Catalunya to right by the hotel (bus no 41) which took about 20-25 minutes. The reception staff were nice and helpful, they got us a cab when we wanted to go out to the near by club catwalk and kept our bags for us when we checked out the next day. Its about a 10 minute walk from the Diagonal Mar shopping centre, where there are restaurants and shops - and 20 mins the other way is the Olympic Village (not much to see there we thought!) There's a spa in the basement (just near the car park) where theres a hot tub (which wasn't working too well), a sauna, steam room and gym - perfect for unwinding after a long day. All in all, a good hotel!

Reviews.Title: “On the beach, but out of town (in a good way).”
Reviews.Author: mark_mclaughlin
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Barceló in February 2007 at the tail end of the Mobile World Congress exhibition in Barcelona. Room was clean, comfortable and of a reasonable size. They honoured my request for a sea view and I was rewarded with an 8th floor with a window that actually opened right out, bringing the sea air right into the room - I imagine in high summer it's absolutely spectacular here. The only minor issue I had was with internet access - after struggling with the online registration, it turns out that you need to purchase a Telefonica WiFi access card from reception; the first one they gave me had clearly been used before and was expired, but this was soon resolved. The hotel location is a little out of the way from the town, but to me this was a huge positive - I'd already spent three days in the centre of town not too far from Plaça Catalunya, and a calmer environment was just what I was after. Staff are easy-going and are professional without being stuffy. Breakfast and in particularly the layout of the buffet seemed a bit random but caters well for those with any specific dietary requests (e.g. there's soya milk, gluten free bread and so on). I didn't get the opportunity to try the restaurant - you can however, take a short walk through the Parc Diagonal Mar to the expansive Diagonal Mar shopping mall where there's plenty of options for eating out - admittedly, mostly chains, but there's a lot of them. I'd definitely stay again, and considered it for a return visit later this year, but it looks like it's very busy for summer bookings already...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel great for beach”
Reviews.Author: chrisedge1976
Reviews.Content: Fanstic hotel. Clean, friendly English speaking reception and very comfortable air con rooms with massive beds. We were on the 9th floor and our room overlooked the beach which was a fantastic sight. We booked the hotel mainly for a beach holiday on Barcelonas very much under-rated beaches and for this the Hotel can't be faulted. A tourist bus stops right outside the hotel and the tube station is not too far away. Port Olympic is a 15-20 minute stroll along the beach with hundreds of restaurants and bars to choose from as well as the many beach cafes that are on each beach. We didn't use the hotel restaurant so can't comment but about the only thing that lets the hotel down is lack of a mini market type store locally where you could buy water etc but other than that can fully recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A business-man's hotel”
Reviews.Author: nzmommy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Barcelo' Atenea Mar in Barcelona as a pre-trip hotel stay for a cruise that left from the port in Barcelona. This was one of the hotels that the cruise line had available. Even though there had been cruise-line families and guests checking in and out for several weeks, the hotel did not seem comfortable handling multiple check-ins needing multiple rooms per party. We arrived early afternoon and were able to secure one of the two rooms we had booked. The check-in person was as helpful as she could be considering it was prior to the scheudled check-in time and they had had many late check-outs. We had two rooms, but not adjoining. They were both on the first floor just above the reception area. The elevators are very small and barely accomodated 2 adults, 2 children and accompanying luggage (2 small, 1 med. and 2 large suitcases). To activate the electricity in the room, you have to put your key card into the slotted box on the wall as you enter. Even though the directions are on the folder that they put your key in, our check-in person did not point this out to us, so we had difficulty figuring out how to activate the lights. If it had been night-time, we would not have figured it out as the room is very dark with the curtains drawn (which makes it very nice for sleeping). The beds are very comfortable although not plush by any means. The carpeting was "indoor - outdoor" but was clean. There was plenty of storage space in the closet. The shower did not have a curtain but a half-glass so great care was needed for children showering and not flooding the tile floor. Our general assessment is that this a great hotel for a business man (or woman) to stay; it was not as well-suited for families or vacationers. However, it was conveniently located to the beach and also had two Bus Turistic' stops on the corner. It is a short walk to Diagonal Mar as well.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the beach”
Reviews.Author: Kouris
Reviews.Content: This is a great Hotel in Barcelona. The hotel is very close to a mall, Diagonal Mar Mall, close to the hop-on hop-off tour bus stop which takes you all over Barcelona for about 19 Euros, there are three lines Blue, Green and Red. The hotel is perfect for going to the beach, it is directly across the street, very close for walking. The beach across the street is very nice (topless), clean and has a little cafe. We have 2 children 8 & 4, they loved the beach and never once asked about the topless part, really not a big deal. The hotel is clean, rooms are nice size, comfortable bed, large bed. We had a roll a way bed brought in for our 8 year old and our 4 year old slept with us, plenty of room. The area of the hotel is quiet, clean and safe. If you are looking for hustle and bustle and lots of action, this hotel is not for you. It is easy to get to the hustle and bustle though. Not a lot of restaurants and cafes in the area. There is a restaurant in the hotel, a little pricey but convenient. Hope this is helpful. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Average Atenea Mar”
Reviews.Author: PassengerX
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days while we were in Barcelona. The rooms were small, but we were lucky enough to get 2 adjoining rooms for all four of us. The rooms were very cheery and posh, and seemed very futuristic as well. I also liked it that you have to put your room key into the slot in the entryway to activate the electricity. The hotel was in walking distance of a beach. Hotel employees were very nice, and fixed our issues with our room keys (it did take two times to get it fixed, though). They spoke excellent English. The beds were very nice, though since we got a second room floor (1st floor in European) that faced the street, we heard a lot of the street noise. Taking a shower was harder than I expected, as when I tried to turn up the heat on the shower, it either became too hot, or when I tried to make the water cool, it became too cool. (There was another person in our party taking a shower the same time as I was in the other room, which means that both showers must've been connected to one water source). The restaurant at the hotel for lunch was average: service, food, atmosphere, and so on. I do, however, recommend the hotel restaurant for their buffet breakfast. Very delicious, with different drinks, various meats, and breakfast foods. TV had 3 English Channels: CNN International, FOX News (yes, from America) and BBC World.

Reviews.Title: “Close to beach - and subway!”
Reviews.Author: ClarenceR
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for three nights at the end of a 10 day holiday in Spain. Really enjoyed our visit - true the manner of the reception desk staff left something to be desired but apart from that we couldn't fault it. Room was big, spotlessly clean (including the bathroom). Sheets changed daily during our stay. Free web access in the hotel lobby near the bar. While it is certainly not in the centre of town the hotel is only a 10-15 minute walk to the Selva Del Mar subway station - very easy to find and the streets, though quiet, felt safe even late in the evenings. It is an area which seems to have seen a great deal of development recently - new apartments blocks and hotels and a nice little park not far away either. The diagonal mar shopping centre (10 mins walk) has some lovely restuarants (don't resort to Burger King there is no need) especially on the top level outdoor area. The beach is just across the road - and lovely for a walk.

Reviews.Title: “Good 4* Hotel overlooking the sea”
Reviews.Author: M_Didius
Reviews.Content: Stayed for just one night at the Atenea Mar at the end of April - business trip. This is good hotel, very clean, modern and bright. Room was a reasonable size overlooking the beach and the sea. Comfortable bed and an excellent bath and shower. The hotel has a cocktail bar with internet access and a gym. The two internet computers seemed to be continually in use by people attending a conference at the hotel. The evening meal in the restaurant was very good if a bit pricy. Breakfast (included in the price for me) was truely excellent, bacon and eggs - scrambled and fried - as well a very comprensive continental buffet. As all the other reviewers have pointed out - this hotel is not in the centre of Barcelona! It is, though, just across from the beach and Diagonal Mar (about 10 minutes walk) is enormous with all the shops you could want! Lots of restaurants as well - including a Burger King :-( Not many other restaurants in the area. To sum up: a good 4* hotel close to the beach but not in the centre of town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay Near The Mediterranean Ocean”
Reviews.Author: Err0neous
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel the week before Thanksgiving, and we had a partial view of the ocean as well as the city. The room was very clean, as well as the bathroom, which is very important to us. The daily breakfast buffet was a lifesaver, with a variety of meats, cheeses, eggs, fruits, bread, cereal, pastries, the greatest coffee, cappucino, or expresso, or fresh juices, all for one price per person. The hotel was a twelve minute walk from the Selva De Mar subway station, which is the yellow line. If you take the blue airport bus in to town, get off at the Plaza Catalunya. When you get off the bus, go right down the street one block to the Urquinoya subway station underground. Take the yellow line (L-4) to Selva De Mar. Then walk down Selva De Mar Street towards the ocean to the hotel which is like 5 blocks away , but you will have to make a right turn on Passeig de Gracia and walk 3 more blocks to the hotel. Near a great shopping mall with a Burger King also. We had the best time, and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Families visiting Barcelona area”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an affordable place to stay near Barcelona, this hotel is a good choice. We debated between staying here or within the city. This worked out for us because we had a rental car and plans to visit other parts of the area also. Couple of notes, if you plan on driving to and from Barcelona there is a 4.50 euro toll each way. The hotel is in a good location, parking was not a problem, and the breakfast was fine. It is around other buildings but still manages to be quiet. There are plenty of restaurants in the area, but we didn't find one that was good. Cafe de las Arts was good for dessert and coffee, but we never had a decent dinner and any of the restaurants (4 nights, each time a different restaurant!) You are near Tarragona, so it was worth the visit, the ruins were interesting. The room itself is not big, very clean, master bed was a bit small and flat. The couch is for one person (sheets provided) and the ottoman opens into another bed (which we figured out the 2nd night). Travelling with two teenagers, it was tight, but we were not in the room that much. The hotel itself was very clean and grounds were well kept. The security was also pretty good. Nice office area, with one computer that was available most times we needed it. Staff was nice and helpful with directions and info.

Reviews.Title: “A Business Class Hotel but TERRIBLE LOCATION for Tourists”
Reviews.Author: Figaro14
Reviews.Content: The hotel is contemporary and the rooms are clean and well appointed. The hotel serves a very good buffet breakfast that is usually included with your room. But here is the problem. The hotel is no where near anything you wish to see in Barcelona. If you take the bus from the hotel to downtown Barcelona, be prepared for a 30 minute bus ride. What's more, this bus stops running at 10 pm. So you will have a lot of difficulty getting back to the hotel. We ended up having to take a cab back. It's extremely inconvenient because you can never return to your hotel to freshen up for dinner. Once your in the main area of Barcelona, your stuck there until you're ready to return to the hotel for the evening. DON'T LET YOUR TRAVEL AGENT BOOK YOU INTO THIS HOTEL, YOU WILL BE SORRY! We were mislead into believing it was in the city center. But its really in the suburbs. Its a great hotel for business people, but not a good choice for Barcelona tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Great Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wtseng
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel, the furnishings were very comtempory and the place is brand new. Its located about 20 -25 mins out of the town centre on bus 41, but directly across from the beach. So it depends on what kind of holiday you want - if its partying you're after then this is probably not the hotel for you. The bed is very comfortable here and staff, though a bit slow, are helpful. Shopping at Diagonal Mar is great, about 7mins walk, or if you're lazy catch the 41 bus, its the last stop. Oh, did i mention the view...very nice indeed. Do remember to buy the T-10 bus card, so you pay 0.63euros per journey instead of the single trips at 1.15euros. The Aerobus stops directly outside el cort ingles at placa catalunya and goes every 15mins on the hour. Barcelona is a fantastic place to go, and make sure you visit Sagrada Familia, although not completed - the architecture is simply amazing!

Reviews.Title: “WOULDN'T RETURN”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and modern however there have been a few things for which I wouldn't go back. POSITIVES: - clean rooms - modern hotel - big buffet breakfast - good price deal NEGATIVES: - slow staff and disengaged (they did not have the "change my room/do not disturb signs" and didn't provide alternatives, weren't that helpful in booking taxis) - dirty trays with dried up food sat outside in the hallways - my girlfriend had food poising, probably from the buffet breakfast - hotel was in the sticks, only way in town bus as taxis would take up to 1hr to come to the hotel! Moreover, not real alternatives for food, drinks, bars in the area I loved Barcellona but if I went back I would choose a more central hotel with better customer service

HotelInfo.Name: Barcelo Atenea Mar
HotelInfo.Address: Paseo Garcia Faria 37-47, 08019 Barcelona, Spain
